Input.threadtitle: What is the tool Prof. Werbach uses for the video?
Input.posts:
Can anyone tell me the tools (hardware/software) Prof. Werbach uses for the video presentations? Seems like a combination of a video camera and an Ipad.
Upvotes:
4
I'd be interested too. Whatever he's using is getting amazing picture quality - good enough that, combined with the lack of clutter in the background, at first (after the initial avatar bit) I wasn't entirely certain it wasn't still CGI (just much higher grade).
Upvotes:
0
Me too. Features I particularly like: Being able to speed up the video! Combination of powerpoint-like screen and the video of Prof. Werbach His ability to annotate each slide Quizes are seamlessly integrated--and appear just when my attention is lagging.
Upvotes:
0
That last one is just a case of good design, using Coursera's quiz-injection tool. The first one is, likewise, part of Coursera - their video player. I've seen the second one elsewhere, which suggests there's a standard tool for that too - but again, I'm curious what he uses to take the video, given the quality. The third one is new to me, though. Some kind of light pen/stylus, with a button to change ink color?
Upvotes:
0
I can't say for sure what tool he uses for his presentations, but we have created a number of virtual training courses similar to this using Techsmith Camtasia. The pen input would most likely be done using a Wacom Bamboo stylus input, which would essentially make your pen the mouse. If you had a blank doodle app open, you could draw in real time as if you were drawing on the screen. As for the actual video and audio of him, Camtasia let's you capture video via a webcam (HD preferably) while simultaneously recording the screen, which is where the doodling would occur. Because it's a layered, timeline style video editing tool, you could then manipulate the locations of the different components depending on content. Camtasia also let's you build quizzes into the video. As I mentioned, I'm not sure that this is the software he is using, but I know firsthand that it could be done with those tools.
